title: Aldi says sorry to dad who 'almost fed son broccoli with squirming caterpillars'
text:

A dad was seconds away from feeding his little boy a meal full of bugs having a ball in a pack of broccoli from Aldi.

The 'disgusting and squirming' caterpillars was the sight that greeted Joao Matos as he prepared a healthy meal for one-year-old Joao Junior.

The fuming parent said he saw the caterpillars among the florets he had bought from the Aldi store in Thetford, Norfolk.

Eating a caterpillar can cause an allergic reaction affecting the skin, eyes and lungs.

(Image: WESSEX NEWS AGENCY)



Joao, 31, an electronics store worker, said "I felt disgusted, especially because that was for my baby.

"I know it means they don't have pesticides but I think it's all down to the quality of the packing factories - they don't care.

"Not even to mention the fact that all the fruit and vegetables from Aldi only last like three days and Tesco last a week or more.

"I know if I hadn't spotted it, my little boy could have been sick or worse.

"This has happened to me a couple of months ago too.

(Image: LeeMcLean/BNPS)

"To be honest I only go there for milk and water now, the rest of my shopping I prefer to pay a bit more and go to Tesco.

"You have to be extra careful but sometimes you can't see it.

"I look properly at everything but sometimes you can't spot it until you

open it.

"There are people that don't mind, but for me that's it, saving some pennies

it's not worth it."

An Aldi spokesman said "Unfortunately, although these instances are rare, this can happen with products that are grown outdoors in natural conditions.

"We apologise to Mr Matos and have shared his feedback with our supplier."

Joao posted images of the caterpillars on social media where it drew mixed reactions.

Many shared his disgust at finding the ugly bugs and shared their own incidents while others said they would have washed and eaten the vegetable.
description: Joao Matos had bought the vegetables from Aldi in Thetford, Norfolk
